member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase
member.summary: Database provider which acts by maintaining a table of applied versions
member.remarks:
Methods on this class are called according to a strict sequence.
When is called: 1. is invoked
When or is called: 1. is called. 2. is called. 3. is called (potentially multiple times) 4. is called. 5. is called.
Different databases require different locking strategies to guard against concurrent migrators.
Databases which support advisory locks typically have a single connection, and use this for obtaining the advisory lock, running migrations, and updating the VersionInfo table. The advisory lock is obtained when creating the VersionInfo table also.
Databases which do not support advisory locks typically have a connection factory. Inside they will create two connections. One creates a transaction and uses it to lock the VersionInfo table, and also to update the VersionInfo table, while the other is used to run migrations.
The subclasses and encapsulate these concepts.

member.name: P:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.TableName
member.summary: Table name used to store version info. Defaults to 'VersionInfo'

member.name: P:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.MaxDescriptionLength
member.summary: If > 0, specifies the maximum length of the 'Description' field. Descriptions longer will be truncated
member.remarks: Database providers which put a maximum length on the Description field should set this to that length

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.EnsurePrerequisitesCreatedAndGetCurrentVersion
member.summary: Ensures that the schema (if appropriate) and version table are created, and returns the current version.
member.remarks:
This is not surrounded by calls to or , so it should do whatever locking is appropriate to guard against concurrent migrators.
If the version table is empty, this should return 0.
member.returns: The current version, or 0

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.EnsurePrerequisitesCreatedAndGetCurrentVersion(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbTransaction)
member.summary: Helper method which ensures that the schema and VersionInfo table are created, and fetches the current version from it, using the given connection and transaction.
member.returns: The current version, or 0

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.BeginOperation
member.summary: Called when or is invoked, before any migrations are run. This should create connections and/or transactions and/or locks if necessary, and return the connection for the migrations to use.
member.returns: Connection for the migrations to use

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.EndOperation
member.summary: Cleans up any connections and/or transactions and/or locks created by
member.remarks: This is always paired with a call to : it is called exactly once for every time that is called.

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetCurrentVersion
member.summary: Fetch the current database schema version, or 0.
member.remarks:
This method is always invoked after a call to , but before a call to . Therefore it may use a connection created by .
If this databases uses locking on the VersionInfo table to guard against concurrent migrators, this method should use the connection that lock was acquired on.
member.returns: The current database schema version, or 0

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetCurrentVersion(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbTransaction)
member.summary: Helper method to fetch the current database version, using the given connection and transaction.
member.remarks: The transaction may be null.
member.param: transaction to use, may be null
member.returns: The current database schema version, or 0

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.UpdateVersion(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Update the VersionInfo table to indicate that the given migration was successfully applied.
member.remarks: This is always invoked after a call to but before a call to , Therefore it may use a connection created by .
member.param: The previous version of the database schema
The version of the new database schema
The description of the migration which was applied

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.UpdateVersion(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbTransaction)
member.summary: Helper method to update the VersionInfo table to indicate that the given migration was successfully applied, using the given connectoin and transaction.
member.param: The previous version of the database schema
The version of the new database schema
The description of the migration which was applied
Transaction to use, may be null

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetCreateSchemaTableSql
member.summary: Should return 'CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS', or similar
member.remarks: Don't override if the database has no concept of schemas

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetCreateVersionTableSql
member.summary: Should return 'CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS', or similar

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetCurrentVersionSql
member.summary: Should return SQL which selects a single long value - the current version - or 0/NULL if there is no current version

member.name: M:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBase.GetSetVersionSql
member.summary: Returns SQL which upgrades to a particular version.
member.remarks: The following parameters may be used: - @Version - the long version to set - @Description - the description of the version - @OldVersion - the long version being migrated from

member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBaseWithAdvisoryLock
member.summary: subclass for databases which use an advisory lock to guard against concurrent migrators.
member.remarks: This uses a single connection, which it does not take ownership of (i.e. it is up to the caller to close it).

member.summary: Gets the connection used for all database operations

This is not surrounded by calls to or , so it should do whatever locking is appropriate to guard against concurrent migrators.

member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.DatabaseProviderBaseWithVersionTableLock
member.summary: subclass for databases which use a transaction on the VersionInfo table to guard against concurrent migrators.
member.remarks: This uses two connections for each operation: one which uses a transaction to acquire a lock on the VersionInfo table and to update it, and another to run migrations on.

member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.MssqlDatabaseProvider
member.summary: Class which can read from / write to a version table in an MSSQL database
member.remarks: MSSQL supports advisory locks, so these are used to guard against concurrent migrators.

member.name: P:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.MssqlDatabaseProvider.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema name used to store the version table.

member.name: P:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.MssqlDatabaseProvider.CreateSchema
member.summary: Controls whether or not to try and create the schema if it does not exist.
member.remarks: If this is set to false then no schema is created. It is the user's responsibility to create the schema (if necessary) with the correct name and permissions before running the . This may be required if the user which Simple.Migrator is running as does not have the correct permissions to check whether the schema has been created.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the advisory lock to acquire

member.summary: This property has been obsoleted. Use instead

member.summary: Acquires an advisory lock using Connection

member.summary: Releases the advisory lock held on Connection

member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.DatabaseProvider.SqliteDatabaseProvider
member.summary: Class which can read from / write to a version table in an SQLite database
member.remarks: SQLite does not support advisory locks, and its transaction model means that we cannot use a transaction on the VersionInfo table to guard against concurrent migrators. Therefore this database does not provide support for concurrent migrators.

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class
member.param: Connection to use to run migrations. The caller is responsible for closing this.

member.summary: No-op: SQLite does not support advisory locks

member.summary: No-op: SQLite does not support advisory locks

member.name: T:SimpleMigrations.IDatabaseProvider`1
member.summary: Interface representing database-type-specific operations which needs to be performed
member.remarks:
Methods on this interface are called according to a strict sequence.
When is called: 1. is invoked
When or is called: 1. is called. 2. is called. 3. is called (potentially multiple times) 4. is called. 5. is called.
Different databases require different locking strategies to guard against concurrent migrators.
Databases which support advisory locks typically have a single connection, and use this for obtaining the advisory lock, running migrations, and updating the VersionInfo table. The advisory lock is obtained when creating the VersionInfo table also.
Databases which do not support advisory locks typically have a connection factory. Inside they will create two connections. One creates a transaction and uses it to lock the VersionInfo table, and also to update the VersionInfo table, while the other is used to run migrations.
The subclasses and encapsulate these concepts.
